alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Central Greenville; Greater Pickens; Southern Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 7:07PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Greenville, northeastern Anderson and east central Pickens Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 707 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles east of Easley, or near Welcome, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenville Downtown, Easley, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Mauldin, Berea, Welcome, Powdersville, Piedmont and Cherrydale Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Central Greenville; Greater Pickens; Southern Greenville
